images.caption: Bramford Meadows. A nine hectare Local Nature Reserve. Flora in the ditches includes: water forget me not, water mint, brooklime and water figwort.

images.title: Bramford Meadows by N Chadwick, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Bramford Meadows

description: This Suffolk village lies just to the west of Ipswich on the River Gipping. The main walking highlight here is the Gipping Valley River Path which you can follow east into Ipswich or north to Claydon and Needham Lake . This walk in the village explores Bramford Meadow which lies on the eastern side of the river. It's a pleasant scenic spot with easy waterside footpaths and a picnic area. Please scroll down for the full list of walks near and around Bramford. The detailed maps below also show a range of footpaths, bridleways and cycle paths in the area.
